inn1.comm: good length angling into the right-hander from over the wicket, Watson strides forward and across to play towards square leg
short of a length and straight, Watson gets behind the line and blocks
a fuller ball and Watson pushes forward to defend but gets an outside edge to the third man boundary, that went along the ground past second slip
defended from the crease back down the pitch
played off the back foot on the off side
a short ball, Watson tries to pull but doesn't middle it, the ball lobs towards midwicket

a confident appeal for lbw first up but the umpire says not out. Darren Sammy has asked for a review. The ball had nipped into the right-hander from a good length just outside off and beat the front-foot drive. Replays are taking a while and when we finally have them they indicate that the impact on the pad was marginally outside off stump. So the decision will stay with the on-field call. That ball was going on to hit off stump. Had the umpire given it out, and Watson reviewed it, it would have stayed out. He's survived by the narrowest of margins.
short and wide outside off, Watson frees those powerful arms and cuts hard over the leaping fielder at point
this time he drives powerfully, and finds the gap at cover, consecutive boundaries
driven on the front foot to mid-on
short ball and far down leg side, that's the first extra of the day
defended on the front foot once again

that's too full on the pads and Watson helps himself to a third boundary in the over, whipping behind square after moving on to the front foot. He could have nearly been dismissed, but has collected 12 runs instead
Warner gets a terrific ball first up, pitching on a good length and seaming across the left-hander at serious pace. Warner pushed at it from the crease and was beaten
straighter line, on the pads, and Warner works it behind square
short of a length outside off, Watson defends towards point
fuller ball outside off, Watson strides forward and drives to cover
Watson moves forward again and drives towards mid-on, Roach is keeping the ball on tight lines and lengths
Watson drives straight and Russell runs to his left from mid-on and dives to prevent the boundary
Watson stays back and cuts a short of a length delivery towards third man, that bounced a bit but Watson controlled his shot
another ball kicks off a good length, Warner stays in his crease and defends on the leg side
Warner plays back to one that was too full to play back to, he prods and gets beaten as the ball seams across him
Warner gets squared up as he tries to defend and the thick outside edge goes towards third man
that's another wide down leg side, two in as many overs for Bravo
short of a length outside off, Watson punches on the back foot to cover
Watson strides forward and pushes towards cover
Warner drives at a fullish ball from his crease and the fielder at cover can't make a clean stop after diving to his right
another full ball angling across Warner, who drives hard but to the man at cover
the length is a bit shorter and Warner pushes off the back foot, playing the ball towards third man
that ball has taken off steeply from just short of a length, Watson began to play at it but then dropped his gloves in the nick of time
played towards third man for a single
Warner gets behind the line of a length ball and defends towards the bowler
with Roach bowling well, the batsmen seem to be targeting Bravo, Watson swivels and pulls a length ball in front of square
Warner goes back to a good length delivery and blocks
short of a length outside off, Warner goes back and punches the ball through cover point
played off the back foot towards cover
Warner has width to work with but he cuts the ball into the ground and to the fielder at point
played off the back foot into the gap at midwicket, just a tap, not a powerful shot
Warner's tried to pull a short of a length ball from outside off stump. He makes contact, but it isn't good contact, and doesn't beat midwicket
driven off the front foot but to the man at cover
played with absolutely no feet movement towards mid-on, Warner's struggling for fluency against Roach
short of a length on the pads, now he can work the ball off the back foot through square
a full toss and Warner can't put it away, hitting it from his crease to cover
Warner jumps back to play a good length ball towards midwicket. Roach's pace and length is keeping Warner away from the front foot

this time the umpire's given Watson lbw and Australia have asked for a review. It's quite similar to the appeal in Bravo's first over, which the umpire said was not out and West Indies reviewed unsuccessfully. Watson came half-forward to a delivery that nipped into him off the pitch. He was beaten on the front-foot defence and hit in front. The ball hit the pad in line and it wasn't too high either. That would have hit the top of middle and leg. Watson has to go. Both teams are a review down.
short of a length and straight, Forrest stands tall in his crease and plays the ball down on the leg side
Bravo tests the new boy with a bouncer, Forrest begins to fend but then lets it go
played from the crease on the leg side
good length around off stump, Forrest pushes towards cover
beaten outside the off stump
Warner stays back to the relatively slower pace and uses the width outside off to punch through point and release some pressure
a wide down leg side, the third of the innings
Warner stays back to a length ball and whips it off his pads through midwicket
defended from the crease on the leg side
short of a length and straight, Warner jumps back and simply swats it with power through midwicket

Warner continues the merry-making after Roach's removal from the attack, he stays back and flays his bat at a length ball angling into him, the fielder at cover dives to take some pace off the ball, but it still reaches the boundary
pulled off the back foot towards fine leg
Warner tries to pull again but doesn't make proper contact. It wasn't short enough
length ball outside off, Warner stays in his crease and cuts towards point
fuller length but wide outside off, Warner stays back and throws his bat at it, bottom-edging the ball into the ground towards the keeper
too short, the ball sat up for Warner and he dismissed it to the midwicket boundary with a powerful pull, hit flat over the in field
fuller length and Warner drives from his crease to mid-off

huge appeal for lbw, but the umpire says not out. That definitely hit the batsmen plumb in front but it might have pitched outside leg. West Indies have no reviews left. Warner played back to a full ball, moving across his crease to whip on the leg side. The impact was not high as well, but the ball pitched outside leg stump.
length ball outside off, driven to mid-off
defended on the front foot, Sammy is bowling wicket to wicket
Forrest gets behind the line of a good length delivery and blocks
a fuller ball on the pads, Forrest stays back and clips to the fielder at midwicket
pushed into a gap at cover point for a quick single
the slower ball around off stump, Warner drives from his crease and Pollard swoops on the ball at point
Forrest plays from his crease and gets beaten by one that spins into him, hitting the pad
tossed up on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
quicker ball on a straight line, played back to the bowler from the crease
quicker but on leg stump this time, Forrest pulls to short fine leg
slower through the air on middle, Forrest stays back and defends towards square leg
a full ball on middle, this time Forrest drives to long-on for a single
that's too short, at that pace on this pitch, Forrest pulls through midwicket and hits his first boundary
fuller length on off stump, Forrest pushes towards the off side and wants a single, Sammy is quick to prevent it
short of a length on off stump, defended on the back foot
too wide outside off, short of a length as well, Forrest stays back and cuts behind point and in front of third man. No room for medium-pace errors on this pitch
defended on the back foot once again to point
short of a length and straight, Forrest defends on the back foot
Narine gives width outside off, Warner goes back to cut towards deep point
that was the doosra, going away from the right-hander, Forrest defended it on the back foot
the straighter one hits Forrest high on the back leg as he tries to defend
defended on the back foot
short with width outside off, Forrest sees an opportunity and cashes in, cutting off the back foot in front of point
defended on the front foot
Warner stays back to a good length ball and punches towards cover
a full ball in the blockhole, it was also the slower ball, Warner dug it out on the off side
short of a length outside off, Warner slaps at it but can't beat Pollard at point
swatted towards deep square leg for a single
a full toss, Forrest taps towards long on. It was a slower full toss.
another slower ball, all around 104 kph, Warner plays towards cover
defended on the back foot, that ball spun into the right-hander rather sharply
this time the spin takes the ball far down leg side, Baugh does well to collect
defended on the leg side
Forrest goes back to turn the offbreak off his pads to short fine leg
defended on the off side off the back foot
Sammy dives to his left at square leg to cut off the shot after Forrest turned it off his pads with the spin
Warner stays back to one that pitches in line with the stumps and spins sharply across him, he gets beaten
good length and angling towards off and middle, Forrest stays in his crease and gets squared up while defending on the off side
Forrest stays on the back foot once again and blocks
he closed the face too early to a full ball angling into his pads and got a leading edge towards extra cover
that's not that short but Forrest moves back and across in a flash, pulling with power from outside off towards deep midwicket, where Dwayne Bravo has to slide to save the four
the slower ball outside off, Forrest plays the drive early and spoons the shot in the air but short of mid-off

that's in the air but short of the fielder diving forward at cover. Warner stayed in his crease and pushed too early at a short of a length slower ball, the ball lobbed off the bat face but dropped a foot in front of the fielder
defended on the front foot
Forrest moves back and across to defend the offbreak on the leg side
the quicker, straighter ball. Forrest defends on the back foot
worked off the pads behind square leg
Warner cuts off the back foot but can't beat backward point
Warner moves forward and opens the face to guide the ball to backward point
good length just outside off, Forrest stays in his crease and defends on the off side
defended on the back foot towards the bowler
Bravo intercepts the push off the front foot at short extra cover and fires the throw in at the bowler's end, forcing the non-striker to hurry back to beat the direct hit
good length delivery angling into the right-hander, Forrest moves back and plays to midwicket
nudged towards midwicket for a quick single, he moved across his crease to tap that from outside off
Warner moves back and hits the ball through point
Warner goes back and cuts the ball with the spin towards deep point where Russell is quick to cover ground and prevent the second
driven to long-on for a single
tossed up on middle stump, Warner strides forward and drives to long off
defended on the back foot, Forrest was hurried by that straighter one
Forrest gets drawn into the front-foot drive outside off and is beaten
defended back to the bowler
short and wide, but doesn't time the cut shot into the covers
back of a length on off stump, defended to the off side
nicely bowled, squares him up a touch as the ball straightens to take an outside edge down to third man
beaten outside off as he tries to guide down to third man, a slower ball that gripped a little on the surface
dragged down short and this time Warner latches on as he pulls it from outside off over deep midwicket
now he cuts through point out to the sweeper
waits on the back foot, opens the face and places into square on the off side
close! Almost gives a return catch. It was a loopy delivery from Samuels and Forrest played a fraction early which sent a leading edge back towards the bowler but it dropped a few inches short
defended on the front foot
beaten outside off by one that goes on straight
tries to play a straight delivery to leg but it squirts into the off side
touch shorter outside off, Forrest on the back foot and pushes down to long on. Good start from Samuels
maintains a probing line on off stump and it's defended into the covers
a slower ball which comes out very loopy from Sammy and it's pulled into the leg side
worked through the off side out to the cover sweeper
back of a length and defended to the leg side
full at the stumps, pushed firmly down to long-on
onto the front foot, drives with an open face and has to stop the shot a little so it doesn't go in the air to cover
quicker and flatter to start the over, spearing towards leg stump and tucked to midwicket
breakthrough for West Indies. Forrest's struggles are over. He came down the pitch and the ball beat the outside to provide Baugh the chance of a simple stumping.
full at off stump and driven to cover
touch shorter, it turns a fraction and Hussey opens the face towards backward point
full at middle stump and pushed back to the bowler

gone! Superb catch from Pollard and two in the over for Samuels. Warner punched it off the back foot and Pollard flung himself low to his left at cover to grab it inches from the turf. Anything in the air near Pollard is always dangerous, he's an incredible fielder.
starts on leg stump and it's neatly flicked in front of square...extra pace on the ball already helping
good length on off stump, defended to the off side
banged in a touch shorter, keeps Hussey on the back foot as he defends at the top of the bounce
staying parked on the back foot but this is a touch fuller and is played square on the off side

wow, where did that come from? An excellent bouncer from Roach which really climbed and took Hussey on the shoulder as he tried to sway out of the line. Baugh took the catch and West Indies were confident, but a good decision from umpire Dharmasena
pushed into the off side
worked from middle and leg into the on side
leans forward and defends to the covers
played square into the covers
full at the stumps and pushed back to the bowler...good pressure being built
another dot ball as Hussey can't get this through the covers
excellent stuff from Samuels as this one is only bunted to mid-on
good yorker and dug out back to the bowler
played square into the off side
West Indies right on top now. In the channel outside off from Roach, Hussey pushed without much footwork and got a thin edge to the keeper
defends his first ball in ODIs back to the bowler from off stump
beaten outside off, good pace from Roach and Bailey fences at the delivery which doesn't carry through to Baugh
back of a length and defended to the off side
tight leave. Angled across the left hander and it wasn't miles away from off stump
low full toss outside off and it's driven through the covers
defended off the back foot towards point
dragged down a little short and wide this time, Hussey waits then places his cut wide of backward point
floated up a touch fuller, draws the batsman forward and there's some deft placement from Hussey to find a gap at cover
tucked off the pads
played square on the off side
cramped for room, he shaped to cut but was close to the body so could only defend to point
tucked into the leg side
back of a length on middle and off, defended into the off side...Russell hitting the splice quite hard in this over
on off stump, defended square into the off side and that completes a good comeback over by Russell
taken from outside off stump and tucked into the gap at square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, comes onto the front foot and defended to cover
on leg stump, worked through short fine leg
beaten! Nicely bowled. It turned quite sharply to beat the outside edge as he played foward
neatly placed through the off side and there's an rare misfield from Pollard at cover which allows a couple
comes round the wicket for the final, it's a touch short and Hussey cuts but picks out point
full on off stump, he had to jab down quite sharply to keep that from scooting through
offcutter, taking the pace off the ball and defended
mixing his pace up nicely and not offering any width to the batsman
touch too straight and it gives him a chance to work into midwicket
full on off stump, Hussey makes sure he gets well forward and plays to the covers
pitched up on middle and he can't get it away
pressure building on Bailey as he notches up another dot ball
ah, then he's offered a gift from Samuels. Dropped in short and pulled away to beat deep square-leg. First poor delivery in a long time
defended out to midwicket
tucked off the stumps through the leg side
round the wicket, on middle stump and Hussey doesn't beat midwicket
quicker this time, Hussey rolls his wrists to find a gap through square leg
picked off from around leg stump into space at midwicket
appeal for lbw as Bailey misses his whip across the line but that was always shaping down the leg side
full outside off, driven quite sweetly but he picks out mid-off
another slower delivery and this grips considerable, played nicely with soft hands into the leg side
aims for the yorker and comes out as a low full toss which is pushed down the ground
another tight over completed as Hussey defends square on the off side
worked down the ground to long-on
round the wicket, on off stump, defended square on the off side
pushed in a fraction quicker and drifts towards leg stump, takes the pad and bobbles towards square leg
some more sharp turn for Samuels and Bailey has to take his bottom hand off the bat to keep the ball down
pushed into the off side
the batsman was almost done by some low bounce as he went for a pull and the ball scooted under the bat. Wasn't far from taking off stump
outside off stump, angled down to third man
on the back foot and tucked down to fine leg
beaten by some more low bounce outside off stump as Hussey tries to run down to third man again
dragged down short but Hussey can't really take advantage as his pull picks out deep square-leg
whipped away from middle stump with good use of the wrists
rolls his fingers across this one and it's defended square on the off side
played square into the off side
on middle, worked into midwicket
speared into at the toes, half an appeal but never with any real confidence
pushed down the ground to long-on
nicely bowled, turns and bounces at Hussey who plays it with soft hands
defended to the off side
a rare delivery and Bailey has time to rock onto the back foot and find the gap wide of the deep square-leg
guided down to third man
opens the face towards point to rotate the strike
defended to the off side
round the wicket, tucked into the leg side
just starting to pick up a few more singles how, but not doing major damage to West Indies at the moment
cut hard down to third man, was a touch short outside off stump
rips past the outside edge with turn and bounce
worked into the leg side
stays quite deep in his crease and flips this into the midwicket area
defended to the off side
can't beat square leg as he flicks off the pads
full on off stump and defended to the off side
tries to cut but doesn't get much timing
lovely delivery, pushed even fuller outside off and catches the batsman flat-footed as he drives and there's almost an edge to the keeper
drifting towards leg stump, takes the pad to short fine-leg...there's a direct hit but the batsman is home by a long way
full outside off and drilled very firmly straight to cover
nice line on off stump, squares Bailey up a little as he defends
pushed to the leg side
the dot balls continue to pile up as he plays to point
plays with the spin through the leg side
more sharp spin for Narine as Hussey tries to play through the off side
left alone outside off stump as Narine continues to prove very effective
Good length and straight, defended back to the bowler
A full delivery on of and middle stump, the batsman stays in his crease and plays towards long on
a short ball and Hussey tries to pull, the top edge lobs behind the wicketkeeper
played from the crease behind point for a single, he got an outside edge as he pushed at the good length ball angling across him
Baugh does well to dive to his left and collect the ball after the batsmen inside-edged the pull
tries to pull but misses, the ball goes towards backward square leg for leg byes
Hussey gets down on one knee and sweeps behind square
this time Bailey attempts the reverse sweep and misses, the ball spins past his body and Baugh reaches out to collect, he gets glove on it but the ball trickles towards third man
Hussey goes back and drives the ball through cover point
defended on the front foot
Bailey gets an outside edge while trying to drive, the ball goes fine to the third man boundary
pulled off the back foot to long on

Bailey moves right across his stumps to scoop a full ball towards fine leg, he missed and was hit on the back boot, the impact was outside the line of off stump though, so Bravo's appeal for lbw was turned down

a full ball on middle stump and Bailey swings it towards deep square leg, the fielder runs to his right on the boundary and dives, preventing the ball from reaching the boundary, another fielder running to his left from fine leg picks it up
driven to long on for a single
Hussey steps out of his crease and steers a length ball towards third man
a full delivery swinging into the right-hander, Bailey makes room and hits towards midwicket

caught at long-on! Hussey came out of his crease and lofted a length ball, it was the slower ball though and Hussey mis-timed the shot as a result, hitting it straight to Roach a few yards in from the boundary

Wade hasn't survived his first ball. Narine pitched the offbreak on a good length on middle and off stump, drawing the batsmen forward. He then spun it across the left-hander, inducing the outside edge as Wade tried to defend. Bravo took a low catch at first slip
he gets an outside edge on the off side as he tries to defend
this time it's the inside edge on the leg side as he pushes forward to block
the quick one bowled flat outside off, the batsman lets it go
driven on the front foot to long-on
that offbreak spun and bounced but the line was down leg side, the batsman tried to pull and got some bat on it towards fine leg
that's full and down leg side, he'll have to bowl that again
a slower ball bowled full on middle, played in front of square for a single
in the blockhole but the batsmen manages to dig it out towards square leg
full and straight, driven off the front foot towards long-on
another one nearly in the blockhole on off stump, driven on the front foot towards extra cover
a full toss on the pads, glanced towards fine leg for just the single, the batsman will feel he's missed out there
he's tried to play that through the leg side but hit it on to his boot, Bravo runs towards short cover to field
defended back to the bowler on the front foot
he's tried to cut a straighter one from outside off and misses
Bailey gets in all sorts of trouble as he tries to cut a big ripping offbreak, he misses and gets hit on the thigh
played towards long on for a single
the quicker straighter ball, played off the front foot behind square on the leg side
short of a length around off, the batsman goes back and cuts towards deep point
a full toss and the batsman swats it towards midwicket, didn't look to put it beyond the boundary
a slower ball bowled short of a length outside off, played to short third man
Christian tries to pull a ball that's too full to be pulled and gets hit on the body, he manages to recover and run a quick leg bye
edged and four! Roach bowled a low full toss outside off stump, the batsman backed away and tried to hit through the off side, he got an inside edge between the keeper and short fine leg
another one to the third man boundary! Bailey gets a lot more bat on this one after backing away towards leg, cutting past the fielder at short third man

Roach bowls a swinging yorker and has Bailey in a tangle, the ball goes close on the leg side but Roach doesn't pick up after he rushed across, Bailey was a fair way out of his crease. That ball hit Bailey flush on the boot, looked a good lbw shout
the slower ball on a hittable length and Christian swings hard, powering the ball to the square leg boundary where the fielder fails to stop it and then has to hurdle the advertisement hoardings
width outside off stump and Christian cuts towards deep point
a slower ball in the blockhole, played back to the bowler
too full and on the pads, the yorker gone wrong, Christian swings and gets a bit of an inside edge that takes the ball to the fine leg boundary
driven towards long off for a single
Bailey backs away and swings across the line, slogging the ball towards deep midwicket

Bailey's fallen two short of a half-century on debut. He backed away towards leg to create room and hit on the off side. He ended up scooping the ball high in the air and the fielder from the cover-point boundary came in to take a well-judged catch
a full and straight delivery, hit from the crease to deep midwicket
short of a length and straight, Lee takes one hand off the bat and turns his head away from the ball as he fends at it
in the blockhole around off stump, dug out towards midwicket
Lee plays another short of a length delivery awkwardly
a low full toss outside off, a slower one as well, the batsman swung too early and was beaten
short of a length, slow again, played off the back foot on the off side
hit from the crease towards long off
the batsman backs away and swings, aiming for deep midwicket, the ball tails into him and the inside edge goes towards fine leg

caught by Johnson Charles, who was running in from deep midwicket. Bravo delivered another slow offcutter that gripped the pitch, Lee was through his leg-side swing too early and mis-hit it high in the air. The fielder judged the catch well on the move
Christian charges and slogs at a slower ball delivered from round the wicket, he was beaten
the batsman misses the heave on the leg side and gets hit on the pad by another slower ball, Australia finish with 204

inn2.comm: outside off, left alone and carries at waist-height to Matthew Wade
touch of extra bounce outside off, he rides it well and guides the ball to third man to open the scoring
beaten first up, shapes away nicely from the right hander and curves past the outside edge...slightly tentative footwork from Charles
good line on off stump and decent pace, defends from the crease and point does the fielding
swings down the leg side but had started on the wrong line as well...the umpire gets to stretch his arms
fetch that! Dismissive way to get off the mark as he picks this up from outside off stump and swings it through midwicket. Nice way to treat Brett Lee.
targets the leg side again, but this time doesn't connect as cleanly as he pulls a good-length delivery from off stump to deep square-leg. Certainly not playing Lee's reputation
his first delivery doesn't bounce much on off stump and Charles jabs down to keep it out
angled towards the legs, Charles shapes to pull it away but misses out and it strikes the pads
a fraction of width offered up and he takes advantage with a stand-and-deliver square drive which threads the gap between point and cover
driven on the up, fine start by Charles. Was full outside off and he drilled it past mid-off with a high follow through. Well balanced
now he's back in defence to a delivery on off stump
banged in a bit shorter, Charles' eyes light up at the prospect of a pull but he slightly loses his shape on the shot and misses out
outside off stump and Powell shoulders arms
pushes this one up a foot further outside off and the batsman isn't interested in playing...looks like he's leaving the shot-making to Charles
on off stump this time and draws a shot from Powell as he drives to cover
a nice-looking, punchy drive straight to short cover
comes onto the front foot and plays with a slightly open face to backward point who leaps to field the field
not able to find any gaps in that over and it ends with another flowing drive that picks out one of the cover ring

early strike, a flashing drive from Charles and he played it with such power that it carried comfortably to third man where the fielder took a good catch coming forward. Charles was only going to play one way.
good length on off stump, looked like an off-cutter from McKay, and it's defended backward of square on the leg side
played into the leg side
goes fuller at the stumps and Samuels defends from the crease
dropped square on the off side with soft hands neither slip or backward point can stop the single
doesn't bounce much outside off stump and Powell plays with an open face to third man
back of a length on middle and off, Powell camped on the back foot and plays to midwicket
a bounce from Lee, Powell is through his shot early and is taken on the left shoulder as he swings through
lovely shot, big stride forward to a full delivery and drives strongly square through the off side past point
goes very full, but not quite yorker-length, and it's dug out to mid-on
moment of good fortune, he aims another booming drive and this time it comes off the inside edge and flies past the stumps to short fine-leg
excellent yorker to finish with, that was right on target for middle stump but Powell managed to get his feet out of the line and clamp the bat down
probing line outside off and this keeps low, Samuels just manages to get an inside on it
the batsman is more comfortable in defence this time as he plays to the off side
on off stump, Samuels not really getting forward and defends back to the bowler
an off-cutter which is played square to point
tight stuff now from McKay and Samuels concentrating on defence as he plays into the off side
drifts towards middle and leg with the final ball but it doesn't cost anything as Samuels flicks straight to short fine-leg
continues around the wicket and Powell opens the face fine of third man which means there is a couple available
starts quite wide outside off and a comfortable leave
defended into his pads by Powell and it bobbles into the off side
oh dear, that's very soft. Dropped in short by Lee, Powell went for the pull but lobbed a simple catch to mid-on who took it neatly at head-height
leaves his first ball outside off
beaten by a really good one. It angled in towards the left hander from around the wicket then nipped away to beat the edge.
stays outside off stump, Samuels comes half forward and defends to backward point
defends from the crease towards the on side
goes for a drive and the difficultly in timing on this pitch is shown as it squirts off an inside edge towards square leg
defends from around leg stump back to the bowler
on off stump, defended with a push to backward point
a strangled shout for a catch down the leg side but neither bowler or keeper was at all convinced
well bowled, Samuels got into a tangle as he tried to play to the leg side and gets a leading edge into the off side but it went along the ground
a much more solid defensive shot this time as he plays into the off side
slower ball from Lee and it almost deceived the batsman but he picked it at the last moment and didn't push too hard which could have led to a catch
finds the outside edge, played with soft hands and it runs fine enough to beat a diving third man. Was actually very well controlled by Samuels
defended on the back foot
defends to backward point
he's back the crease and defends with a straight bat towards the bowler
worked past short midwicket but mid-on is prowling behind him to prevent any run
beats the edge, a pretty loose shot from Bravo as he tries to force it off the back foot but was playing a long way from his body
nips back from a good length, takes an inside edge into the pads and rolls towards square leg
played towards point
lovely timing and placement, rare poor delivery outside leg stump and Bravo flicks it away with a roll of wrists to comfortably beat deep square
defended on the back foot to the bowler
played towards third man for a single
good length and straight, wicket to wicket line, Bravo gets behind it and blocks
Bravo defends watchfully on the leg side again
fuller ball outside off stump, Bravo drives from his crease but can't get past cover

Bravo's been run out! He pushed the ball off his pads towards wide mid-on and took on Brett Lee, who is a phenomenal athlete even now. Lee swooped on the ball after sprinting to his left and let the throw rip at the stumps at the bowler's end, hitting them with Bravo yards out of his crease. He had played that off his front foot and didn't hesitate that much before running, he still did not have a chance
a shout for lbw after Bravo tries to defend on the front foot and is hit on the pad, that wasn't hitting, it had spun too much towards leg
defended on the front foot
played off the back foot
Bravo goes back and plays a powerful drive through cover, Hussey had dropped a bit too short
defended on the front foot
too short once again, Bravo rocks back and pulls the ball in the air and into the gap on the midwicket boundary
good length on off and middle, Samuels defends towards the bowler
that was a quick ball outside off and Wade appealed confidently for caught behind, while Watson did not. Samuels prodded at a good length ball from his crease and was beaten
Samuels pushes forward to a fuller ball and gets an edge towards third man
drops a bit short and Bravo pulls towards long leg with one leg in the air
played off the pads towards fine leg
good length and straight, defended towards the bowler
tossed up from round the wicket, played to midwicket on the front foot
a full toss and Samuels glances it towards fine leg
Samuels moves forward to defend a flat ball on off stump
turned off the pads towards fine leg
played off the front foot on the off side
a long hop and Bravo has sent the ball far over the deep midwicket boundary with a fierce pull off the back foot, a lot of muscle in that shot
a full ball swinging into the right-hander, Samuels pushes at it and gets an outside edge behind point
shot! Bravo thrusts on to the front foot, picks up a length ball and blasts it over the head of the fielder at mid-off, he hit that with tremendous flair
good length and straight, Bravo defends
short of a length outside off, Bravo gets on to the front foot and plays an eye-catching square drive through point, he hit that ball on the up
moves forward and across to play a full ball towards mid-on
Bravo strides forward and defends on the off side
bowled full from round the wicket into the right-hander, defended on the off side
pushed from the crease towards mid-on
that's been dropped beyond the long-off boundary! Samuels stepped out of his crease and blasted the ball flat and far, hitting it with a lot of power
driven hard towards the fielder at mid-on
he's done it again, this time hitting hit over the bowler's head for a six, he stepped out of his crease as the ball angled into him and hit it inside out almost

that's the biggest of them all, Samuels has stepped out of his crease, got to the pitch of the ball, and lofted it straight over the bowler's head again, I don't think we'll be seeing Doherty during the Powerplay any more
good length on off, defended on the front foot
fuller length on middle and leg, played off the pads to square leg
defended towards the bowler, that was slightly in the air but dropped short of Watson on his follow through
that's not short enough to pull and Bravo mis-times it to mid-on
pushed off the front foot towards point, they think about the single but decide against it
good length and straight, Bravo gets behind the line and defends
the slower ball on a good length outside off, Samuels gets beaten as he plays off the front foot
Samuels strides forward and defends towards point
good length angling into off stump again, Samuels defends from his crease
this time Samuels strides forward and shoulders arms, Christian got that ball to move towards the keeper's right, but after it passed the batsman
he lets another one go outside off stump
defended from the crease towards the off side
and Bravo welcomes him, whipping the ball off his pads and over the head of the fielder at midwicket, he came a long way out of his crease to hit that
defended on the front foot
played towards long-off for a single
Doherty drifts the ball into the right-hander from round the wicket, pitches on middle, and rips it across the outside edge of Samuels' forward defence, superb ball
Samuels plays the ball towards short fine leg
played off the pads on the leg side
good length and straight, Bravo defends on the front foot
width outside off stump and Bravo plays a flamboyant square drive, freeing his arms and swinging with a flourish
middle stump line, Samuels gets behind it and blocks
Samuels goes back and opens the face to steer a short of a length ball towards third man
Bravo opens the face this time to steer to third man
full length and straight, defended back to the bowler
defended on the front foot
that ball has jumped off the pitch away from the right-hander, big turn, and Wade does well to collect
defended on the front foot
that's a huge heave from the batsman and he's connected with nothing, the ball pitched middle and turned past off, just missing the stumps, it beat the keeper as well
played off the front foot
defended on the off side
defended with soft hands to backward point
driven firmly but straight to mid-off
tight lines from Watson and it's played off the front foot to cover

well, you don't see that very often from Australia...Shane Watson has let a ball through his legs at mid-off which has gifted West Indies a boundary. Was a well-time drive, but Watson should have stopped it
played from the crease to the leg side
opens the face to backward point...would have been maiden without that misfield
nicely flighted on off stump, turns a little and is defended to cover
played into the covers
half an appeal from Wade but no-one else as Samuels comes forward and is taken on the pad...going down the leg side with the angle
driven out to the cover sweeper
hops onto the back foot and places this through the covers
flicked through the leg side wide of midwicket
off-cutter outside off stump which is played to backward point
good length, accurate from Christian, and it's defended to the bowler
worked to midwicket and can't beat the man inside the circle
he's keeping it simple, on a length around off stump, and it's again defended

and there's his reward! A lovely delivery from Christian, another off-cutter which bites in the surface and zips between bat and pad to take off stump. Bit of a loose shot, but credit to the bowler for his consistency. Just what Australia needed as West Indies had settled nicely with this stand
defended comfortably to midwicket
angled in towards the right hander who defends coming forward
driven to mid-on

another goes. What was Samuels thinking? Comes down the pitch to launch this over the leg side and gets an outside edge which is well taken at slip. Watson will have been unsighted for a while. Pretty ungainly from Samuels given a wicket had just fallen

we have a review from Australia against Baugh first ball. Appeal for lbw as he's beaten on the back foot and it's given not out. Doesn't look out, missing leg stump? Well, it's just clipping the outside of leg stump so the on-field call stands
played to the on side
this time he's gone! Aims an ambitious sweep and is taken on the back leg right in front of middle. Another awful piece of shot selection considering the match position
beaten outside off stump as he tries to guide this square through the off side
loses his line down the leg side, Pollard connects well with his flick but picks out fine leg
plays back and defends
onto the front and pushes out to the cover sweeper
takes the pad and a strangled shout from Christian...replays confirm it was going down the leg side
driven firmly into the covers
flighted on middle and leg, straightens and touch and is defended to the on side. How long can Pollard resist?
pushed out to midwicket from a leg-stump line
on the back foot and driven to cover
finds the gap this time with an open face this and the sweeper is in action
slightly quicker this time and defended off the back foot by Russell

big appeal for a stumping...and gone! Wade was very confident. Russell stretched forward and was beaten by the spin. His foot appears to be on the line, but it's a tight call. The third umpire has given him, a brave decision from the TV official. West Indies sink further.
worked out to deep square leg
full outside off and pushed firmly to cover
dabbed into the off side
back of a length, driven towards mid-off and they set off for the single straight away so even if David Hussey had hit direct he was safe
this demise is proving very rapid. Another limp dismissal as Pollard chips to midwicket trying to drive, another batsman finding timing hard on this surface. Australia closing in swiftly.
outside off and left alone
touch short from Doherty, gives Sammy time to go onto the back foot and drive out to deep cover
round the wicket, on off stump, defended on the front foot
that's four for Doherty and he's been gifted most of them. This time Narine tries to clear long-on put doesn't get the distance and it's a simple catch. What a sad display from West Indies
onto the front foot and defends with bat and pad together
nearly does with this one which scoots through quick and it's defended off the back foot
Sammy succeeds where Narine failed by driving this comfortably into the stands at long-off...effortless strike
round the wicket, starts with a bouncer that sails over Roach's back
banged in short again, Roach goes onto the back foot and defends down in front of short leg
pushed too far outside leg stump and an easy call for a wide
back over the wicket, short of a length on off stump and defended to the covers
nicely played off the back foot with an open face and soft hands towards backward point
aims for the yorker and it comes out as a low full toss which is clipped to mid-on
inside edge past leg stump means he keeps the strike
and the first ball is dispatched into the stands. Dragged down  very short by Doherty and Sammy pulls it high over deep midwicket
well struck again by Sammy - a hint of anger in these shots - as he goes down on one knee and slog-sweeps it flat through midwicket
quicker and flatter, tucked into the leg side
uses his feet, doesn't quite get it out of the middle but it's struck well enough wide of mid-on...late counter-attack from Sammy
pushed into the off side
he manages to keep the strike again by working this away
aims for a full, swinging yorker which is dug out to the leg side
a good short ball and it costs Lee four...bounced and nipped into Sammy then took the inside edge which flew past Wade

missed chance, he gets away with a big top edge this time...another good bouncer that cramps him for room, Sammy goes for the pull and Doherty from short fine-leg can't steady himself under the chance and doesn't even get a hand on it
back in the crease and defends
on off stump, solidly defended to the covers...Roach has shown batting ability in the past
strikes Roach with a well-directed short ball. Not very well played as he took his eye off it and takes a blow on the shoulder
starts with a slower-ball gone wrong that loops out well wide of off stump
he has plenty of power and picks this up from a good length outside off, sending it over the midwicket boundary again
all over, Sammy's late flourish is ended and so is the match. He tries to try over the off side and only picks out cover
